text: It is said the Matriach once wrestled a shark, only to drag it on land and display it as a trophy for those that dare challenge her. The banner carried by her personal retinue is a reminder of that impressive yet unconfirmed achievement. Regardless, it is a sight to be hold and renowned across the seas.
Dauhpina's Banner

Brother Egbert Huibers is the Master of Novices of the Cult of Manann. In his late 40s, his intense grey eyes stare out from under salt-and-pepper eyebrows and a shaved head. A single gold loop hangs from his left ear. His weathered skin testifies to years spent at sea under a hot sun. Brother Egbert is devoted to Manaan and the sea. He brags that he knew how to swim before he could walk. He has a distinct distaste of what he calls "dry-landers''.
Egbert Huibers

Odrall the Devout was renowned for his piety and a holy obsession with exploration. As High Priest of Manann he discovered large parts of the new world. During his travels he gained knowledge about the magical essense that lingers within the deeps. He became obsessed with the idea of obtaining Manann's blessing and was convinced the way to do so was to dive in to the deep and embrace Manann. He never resurfaced.
Odrall the Devout's Biography
This barded warhorse comes from the stable of the Knights Mariner, it's expertly trained in galloping up and down the harsh beaches of the Old World.
Floodstrider
The altar prominently features Manann, bearing his trident and five-tined crown.
War Altar of Manann
The majestic beast called Voorwind is the Matriarch's personal envoy, it's a sight to behold to see it accelerate between the masts of incoming ships.
Voorwind
Should a Battle Wizard need a mount, then his station would ensure he receives a warhorse of good breed.
Warhorse
Battle Wizards are rarely armoured for it interferes with their casting, yet a steed can and should be barded to add a level of protection.
Barded Warhorse

Manann's five-tined crown is without a fragment of a doubt the most valued and mystical artifact tied to Manann. It is said to be forged within the Maelstrom of the Vortex and that it holds the very essence of the sea. It is of unspoken power and was considered lost after The Red Chaos Whale stole it in a Stromfel plot.
The Crown of Manann
Walblatt's Trident

Captain Walblatt is a well-known member of the Knights Mariner, and tales of his exploits are told throughout the coastal regions of the Old World. It is not prowess in battle or devotion that these legends tell of, but of the quest Walblatt has tirelessly devoted himself to for nigh on a decade. For the past nine years, since the last, ill-fated voyage of the templar warship, Manannâ€™s Trident, of which Walblatt is the only survivor, he has hunted the great red Chaos whale that wrecked his ship, swallowed his Trident and killed his crewmates. Unscathed and spotless, the Trident emerges from the bested Whale's stomach. Surely this is a gift by Manann himself.
